solution:
```python
import math

def calculate_incircle(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3):
    # Calculate the sides of the triangle
    a = math.sqrt((x2 - x3)**2 + (y2 - y3)**2)
    b = math.sqrt((x1 - x3)**2 + (y1 - y3)**2)
    c = math.sqrt((x1 - x2)**2 + (y1 - y2)**2)

    # Calculate the semi-perimeter
    s = (a + b + c) / 2

    # Calculate the area of the triangle
    area = math.sqrt(s * (s - a) * (s - b) * (s - c))

    # Calculate the inradius
    r = area / s

    # Calculate the coordinates of the incenter
    cx = ((a * x1) + (b * x2) + (c * x3)) / (a + b + c)
    cy = ((a * y1) + (b * y2) + (c * y3)) / (a + b + c)

    return cx, cy, r

# Read the input
x1, y1 = map(float, input().split())
x2, y2 = map(float, input().split())
x3, y3 = map(float, input().split())

# Calculate and print the incenter and inradius
cx, cy, r = calculate_incircle(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3)
print(f"{cx:.12f} {cy:.12f} {r:.12f}")
```
